title: Food Quality Assurance & Regulatory Specialist — Food Manufacturing
description:
Food Quality Assurance & Regulatory Specialist — Food Manufacturing
Ready®, one of the fastest growing sports nutrition companies in America growing over 200% in the past 2 years, with co-owners football future hall of famer, Aaron Donald and basketball superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo, is looking to hire an enthusiastic and hardworking Quality Assurance & Regulatory Specialist with a good eye for detail. You will be responsible for reviewing all aspects of quality and assurance for our co-manufacturers and co-packers, along with coordinating any third party product certifications required. This role will support compliance, quality and technical programs, particularly those relating to regulatory compliant and food label information. In addition, you will assist in testing our company products to ensure they meet the required legal and company standards for safety and quality.
To ensure success as a quality assurance & regulatory specialist, you should have a strong working knowledge of mathematical concepts, excellent visual awareness, and the ability to work with minimal supervision. Ultimately, a top-class quality technician can efficiently monitor the integrity and quality of products. 
Responsibilities:· Interpret and make effective use of technical, legal and food regulatory documents, information and data· Managing the company’s certifications for its products (i.e. NSF Certifications, Kosher, Gluten-Free, Organic)· Inspecting goods or products according to quality and safety standards.· Ensuring goods and products comply with company standards as well as Federal and State law.· Reporting quality anomalies to the supervisor.· Collating test data and drafting quality reports.· Identifying possible areas for improvement in quality control processes.· Responsible for monitoring, evaluating, and reporting verification of processes and procedures including alerting out of compliance results.· Assist in administering the Company's Quality Program in accordance with customer and company requirements to ensure all work is conducted within established Quality guidelines.- Sensory evaluation, visual inspection, and analyses of finished product samples- Review and develop QA procedures- Assist in troubleshooting product discrepancies- Manufacturing & Ingredient supplier audits- Create & Maintain production verification documents including, archival storage & organization, master document storage, and analysis of quality data.- Perform other duties as required Requirements· A working knowledge of the following:- General food safety knowledge and experience- Foreign Material prevention and detection- Knowledge of food safety & quality systems- Working knowledge of food regulatory requirements- Third party certification and auditing processes- High School Diploma or GED required and 5 years’ experience in quality control and assurance in an FDA regulated industry or Bachelor’s Degree in a science related field preferred.- A background in manufacturing and processing environments is desired.- Proven analytical strengths and experience.- Experience in writing reports with strong computer skills- Strong organizational skills, including attention to detail, time management and prioritization to achieve results- Ability to accommodate flexibility in the work schedule (30% Travel)
Compensation Range: $70K - $75K

title: Enterprise Sales Executive
description:
Ashling Partners is at the forefront of the hyper automation revolution! We help clients improve productivity and employee engagement by leveraging intelligent process automation, RPA, Process Intelligence, data capture/OCR and Machine Learning technologies. Our team leverages lean agile principles to make automation gains sustainable and a driving force for digital innovation. As an Enterprise Sales Executive for Ashling Partners, you will be the focal point in the Central Region for Intelligent Automation Solutions, where you are the designated expert.
Founded by business process improvement & technology industry veterans, Ashling Partners values meaningful work for our employees while driving real value for our clients sustainably and continuously. We will always value progress over perfection. While doing so, we strive to continually build a positive, appreciative, and fun culture for our organization. Find us on the INC Best Workplace list for 2021!
Our rapidly growing organization is taking the world by storm, quickly becoming THE global boutique in intelligent automation. We are looking for life-long learners and servant-leaders who are passionate about innovation and the future of work. If this sounds like a place for you, we would love to meet you!
What You Will Do:Be the focal point in the defined geography for intelligent automation solutions, where you are the designated expert.Identify and close new logo and expansion services business across enterprise accounts $2B or greater in revenue.Manage a geography-based territory.Develop co-sell relationships with partner sales peers.Create and executing a mutual actions plan.Develop Account Plans for existing accountsDevelop a knowledge of the Ashling solutions and related business processes.Build competence and sell Ashling value to business decision makers up to C-LevelBuild and certify Intelligent Automation domain expertise.Manage all aspects of the sales cycle, from qualification to closure.Demonstrate Ashling’s capabilities while working with deal team to define and build mutual action plans, account plans, business cases, and key sales deliverables to promote value driven sales cycles.Report on sales activity and forecasts to senior sales management.Manage a fast, intricate sales cycles in a team selling environment.Work closely with sales support functions and achieve a high win rate through quality and sales excellence.Represent Ashling at events, seminars and on social media.Participate in account planning and sales strategy focusing on new customer acquisition and existing customer expansion.Define and articulate differentiators and value for deriving business outcomes through intelligent automation. Must have the ability to understand customer needs and relay our model to meet customers’ business outcome objectives.Actively seek out and participate in both formal and informal training opportunities to continuously develop technical skills and a deeper understanding of the fast-changing intelligent automation landscape.Provide solution gap and development feedback to internal stakeholders.Understand business models, organization, and go to market strategy, leverage where appropriate.Share industry knowledge of customers based on their key drivers internally for new and existing customers.Keep sales and customer relationship management data up to date.
What You Will Bring:Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in a technical field such as engineeringExperience working with companies with $2B in revenue or above.Proven track record in successfully winning new business across sectors in IT services/solutions.Demonstrated, proven track record of success. Preference will be given to those that have demonstrated sales success in a prior position.Understanding of the SaaS procurement lifecycle, fixed-bid/milestone-based solution sales with a strong focus on business outcomes.Record of accomplishment; a proven drive to exceed.Ability to be a quick learner, and a drive to be a continual learner.Passion for Intelligent Automation and understanding technical capabilities such as Robotic Process Automation, OCR Machine Learning, Process Mining, and more.Desire to achieve a high income and the willingness to put forth the effort to do so.Understands the value of service and the cost of ownershipConsistent work effortWilling to be part of a high-trust cultureBe able to pay attention to details and perfect the customer experienceLifelong learner mindsetStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong communication and management skillsUnderstanding of Agile SDLC
Why Ashling Partners:At Ashling Partners, we strive to provide meaningful work in a positive, appreciative and fun culture for our own team. All firm members are referred to as “Ohana,” the Hawaiian word for family, with regards to extended family beyond relatives. The concept emphasizes that extended families are bound together by a common belief, attitude or purpose and members must cooperate and remember one another.Lifelong Learning - In the intelligent automation space change happens fast, in order to support that change, Ashling has developed a culture that enables lifelong learners to continuously develop their skill sets.Diversity of Thought, Culture, Background & Identity – We build diversity, equity, and inclusion capabilities into all facets of our business to support innovation, creativity, and our global growth objectives.Consistently Innovate with Cutting Edge Technology – We offer a continuous model for performance improvement and the opportunity to work with best of breed automation technology stacks.Provide Servant-Based Leadership – We believe the leader’s role is to serve the organization, not the other way around.Practice Stewardship – We work together as peers, regardless of a person’s formal role or authority in the organization.Be Entrepreneurial in Management – We empower people to bring ideas and challenge them with the responsibility to make them successful.Offer Open-Book Finance – We give everyone the opportunity to see the books, how we are being measured and what our score is, so they can feel empowered to impact success.Provide the Best Service – We may not be the cheapest, but we will deliver the best value to our clients.Make Data-Driven Decisions – We are a data-driven organization internally and externally.Be a fun place to work - We provide a positive, appreciative and fun culture.
What Sets Us Apart:Quarterly book allotment (any book of your choice, no cap!)Uncapped training allotmentUnlimited holidaysUnlimited PTO!Immediate 401K contributions

title: Project Manager
description:
Practical Design Partners, LLC (PDP) is seeking a Project Manager to join our Transportation group in metro Atlanta. PDP provides transportation engineering opportunities for a variety of clients including GDOT, local governments, contractors, and developers. We have a collaborative, team-focused culture that also provides flexibility of working location and hours. We strongly believe in diversity and inclusion, so if you are looking for a healthy work environment to support your growth and development, please consider working with us. We offer competitive salaries as well as a defined, performance-based bonus program. We are looking for a candidate with 8+ years of experience, strong technical and communication skills who is eager to learn and grow with PDP!

title: Accounting Specialist
skills_desc:

The accounting specialist will be responsible for daily accounting tasks, including processing debits & credits, journal entries, store billings, etc. In addition, the accounting specialist will carry out relevant administrative duties (e.g. responding to clients via email and handling invoices).

If you are ready to make a significant impact within our supply chain operations, apply today and become part of the Certco family!

title: Purchasing Administrator
description:
Bauer Foundation Corp. (BFC) is a Florida corporation and the U.S. subsidiary of the world-wide operating Bauer Group based in Schrobenhausen, Germany. The Bauer Group is a world- renowned foundation contractor, designer, and builder of the world’s finest foundation equipment.
BFC, as part of the Bauer construction division, is a leader in the execution of complex excavation pits, ground improvement, deep foundations, and vertical seals, utilizing the most up to date equipment and installation techniques. Bauer Foundation Corp. provides all types of foundation solutions and services for industrial, commercial, residential, and governmental construction projects. Bauer Foundation Corp. promotes Bauer services and technology throughout the entire United States.
Job Summary:
The Purchasing Administrator will perform administrative and clerical duties for the purchasing department.
Supervisory Responsibilities:None
Key Duties and Responsibilities:Handle purchase order (PO) requests in SAP B1, as requested by the job sites.Sends purchase orders to suppliers and sends requests for quotes to the market.Support the Accounting department with purchase order amendments in SAP B1, as well as handling PO related invoice issues.Assist the workshop with PO related issues.Support small negotiations with suppliers.Run reports in SAP B1.Research vendors and collects prices, specifications, and other data related to goods and services.Performs other duties as assigned.
RequirementsAbility to follow verbal and written instructions.Ability to learn purchasing procedures and policies.Excellent communication skills for communication with suppliers, internal staff, and management.Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.Experience with Procurement Software (SAP B1, Ariba, Oracle, etc.) preferred.
Education and Experience:Bachelor’s degree preferred, however, experience in lieu of a degree will be considered.At least two years of clerical or administrative experience preferred.Experience in the construction industry and Purchasing / Procurement department preferred.
Physical Requirements:Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
Compensation and benefits
Competitive salary; commensurate with experience.
Benefits offered: health insurance, life insurance, 401(k) plan with employer match, parental leave, tuition assistance, paid holidays and vacation.

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor an employment Visa at this time.


BAUER Foundation Corp. is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: Process Development Manager
description: Are you looking for an opportunity to make a direct impact in patient’s lives? Are you excited by the opportunity to build a strong team? This could be the role for you! Our client is hiring a Sr. Manager – Formulation & Process Development to oversee pharmaceutical product development activities from laboratory scale up till exhibit/PPQ batch manufacturing for sterile injectable products.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Establish R&D process for technology transfer for transferring lab processes to manufacturing site to support ANDA regulatory filings batches.Work closely with site functions – operations, quality, engineering, validation, supply chain, procurement, and MS&T to bring new products to the site.Establish R&D team capability to scale up products at site, troubleshoot any issues arising during process scale up, and during the manufacturing registration batches to support ANDA regulatory filings.Lead New Product Introduction change control process and work with department functional leads for gap assessments.Define process to update product development reports to include scale up data from engineering and exhibit/PPQ batches.Lead engineering and exhibit batch manufacturing process including batch protocols, sampling, and working with manufacturing and quality team in sample management.Lead product transfer gap assessment, in-process control, and FMEA analysis to identify critical/key process parameters.Represent organization to establish R&D laboratory at the company’s manufacturing site including hiring R&D chemists.Oversight and management of site technology transfer of ANDA aseptic products at the site.Translate product development project requirements into a robust, scalable technical design.Resolve complex problems by applying sound engineering principles, utilizing experimental, and analytical methods to a range of technical product development challenges over a range of products from simple sterile injectable vial products to more complex pre-filled syringe combination products and oral solid dosage forms.Work closely with both functional and project managers to identify and mitigate technical issues, manage project milestones to adhere to project timelines.Deliver new drug solutions as a technical leader on a cross-functional project team through all phases of the project lifecycle, from concept through launch.Develop and guide technical design/methodologies to achieve success in developing combination products. Mentor and motivate team members and junior associates while coaching them through activities such as bench studies, pharmaceutical product development data analysis, FMEAs, combination product development, validation requirements, vendor interactions, material, and component specifications. Basic Qualifications and Capabilities:Bachelor of Science Engineering or a similar technical degree. A post graduate degree is desired but not required.Preferred minimum of 12 years related industry experience (it may be a combination with advanced degree education).Experience working in FDA and DEA regulated environment.

 What will you be doing?Prepare and distribute Acquisition Plans and progress leadership to identify improvements and subsequent implementation.Proactively identify synergies and cost savings opportunitiesCollaborate with Product & technology, operations, and sales to integrate acquired organizations financial transactions according to the proper accounting methodology.Develop tools to deliver various company analysis.Develop and manage process maps.Coordinate people and training to communicate and deliver business measures.Analyze fiscal and operational data to assist with financial, capital and workforce planning.Ensure accuracy and timeliness of entry for accounting transactions, source documents and records.Prepare financial reports and ad-hoc reports for operational decision making.Ensure adherence to financial and operational controls.Personal responsibility to manage change.

ACERTUS – Relentless Drive to Deliver!
ACERTUS is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Plant Manager
description: Title: Plant ManagerLocation: Southern VirginiaPosition Summary:The Plant Manager is a key leadership role responsible for overseeing the efficient and safe operations of a manufacturing facility. This position requires a dynamic individual with exceptional management and operational skills to ensure the plant meets production targets, maintains product quality, adheres to safety standards, and maximizes cost-efficiency. The Plant Manager plays an important role in maintaining and enhancing the overall success of the facility.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:• Safety and Compliance:o Maintain a culture of safety and compliance with all relevant regulations and guidelines.o Monitor and promote safe work practices and conduct regular safety audits.• Quality Control:o Implement and enforce strict quality control measures to ensure that products meet or exceed industry and company standards.o Investigate and address any quality issues promptly to prevent recurrence.• Inventory and Supply Chain Management:o Manage raw material and finished goods inventory to optimize stock levels and reduce excess holding costs.o Collaborate with the supply chain team to ensure timely and cost-effective material procurement.• Production Management:o Develop and execute production plans to meet or exceed output targets while maintaining product quality and efficiency.o Implement continuous improvement strategies to enhance production processes and reduce waste.• Budgeting and Cost Management:o Develop and manage the plant's budget, monitoring expenses and identifying cost-saving opportunities.o Optimize resource allocation and cost-effective production processes.• Team Leadership:o Recruit, train, and develop a high-performing team.o Foster a collaborative and engaged workforce, setting clear expectations, and providing regular feedback.• Maintenance and Equipment:o Oversee maintenance schedules and equipment reliability to minimize downtime.o Ensure that all equipment is in optimal working condition and coordinate repairs when necessary.• Environmental Stewardship:o Implement environmentally responsible practices, minimizing the plant's environmental footprint.o Comply with relevant environmental regulations and seek opportunities for sustainability improvements.• Communication and Reporting:o Maintain open and effective communication with senior management, employees, and other relevant stakeholders.o Provide regular reports on plant performance, including key performance indicators (KPIs).• Up to 15% travel may be required.

title: Data Scientist
description:

Job SummaryThis position will offer flexibility for a fully, on-campus schedule or a hybrid schedule with three days on-campus and two days remote.
The Institute for Biomedical Informatics is looking for a Data Scientist II to join our team! This position will be primarily responsible for performing statistical analysis on large healthcare data sets to uncover insights that improve patient care and outcomes, identify important relationships and trends, and communicate findings to the University and scientific community. This position has the following responsibilities:
Collect, organize and analyze complex healthcare data from sources such as electronic health records, insurance claims, clinical trials, and registriesBuild predictive models and machine learning algorithms to derive insights from healthcare dataInterpret findings from statistical analyses and quantitative research and effectively communicate results to key stakeholdersIdentify opportunities to expand data collection to support health outcomes research initiativesStay current on developments in data science, methods and best practices for health outcomes researchDocument all data preparation and analysis code thoroughly for reproducibility
This position will work closely with staff and faculty to complete analysis, develop reports, collaborate in writing journal articles, and attend and present at national meetings. The Data Scientist should be familiar with various data management and BI reporting tools. The position will utilize leadership skills to lead meetings and oversee statistical analyses conducted by graduate research students and staff members.

Required Education / ExperienceMaster's degree and five (5) years of experience OR equivalent (below)High School diploma or GED and eleven (11) years of experienceAssociate’s degree and nine (9) years of experienceBachelor's degree and seven (7) years of experienceDoctorate degree and two (2) years of experience
The University of Kentucky uses equivalencies in determining if a potential applicant meets the minimum education and experience. Related experience can be substituted for education. Click here for more information about equivalencies: http://www.uky.edu/hr/employment/working-uk/equivalencies
Required License/Registration/CertificationNone
Preferred Education / ExperiencePhD preferred.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
About us
Embrace Software focuses on acquiring and growing niche software businesses that provide mission-critical solutions across multiple industries. In the last 2 years, we grew through acquisitions from a team of 10 to over 160. Headquartered in Tampa, USA, with locations in the UK, Canada and India.
We expect a minimum growth of 100% in the next 12 months and are preparing for the next 10x growth.

Job Description
This is a remote position.
Embrace Software is recruiting for its portfolio company, Better Branch Technology, which specializes in providing cutting-edge software solutions tailored for credit unions to streamline appointment and visit management processes. BBT is committed to empowering credit unions with efficient tools to enhance member experience and optimize operational efficiency.
We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales Development Representative to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for generating and closing leads within the credit union industry. They will play a key role in showcasing the capabilities of our software through effective demonstrations and consultations with prospective clients. The candidate should possess a strong understanding of sales principles, excellent communication skills, and a passion for technology.
Responsibilities:Lead Generation: Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities within the credit union sector through research, networking, and cold calling.
Consultative Selling: Understand the unique needs and pain points of prospective clients and effectively communicate how our software solutions can address their challenges and add value to their operations.
Product Demonstration: Conduct engaging and informative software demonstrations for potential clients, showcasing key features, benefits, and functionalities.
Relationship Building: Build and maintain strong relationships with prospects, key decision-makers, and industry influencers to foster trust and credibility.
Sales Pipeline Management: Manage the sales pipeline from lead generation to closure, ensuring timely follow-up and thorough documentation of all sales activities in CRM software.
Collaboration: Work closely with the marketing team to develop targeted sales campaigns, collateral, and messaging to support lead-generation efforts.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated on industry trends, competitor offerings, and emerging technologies to effectively position our software solutions in the market.
Requirements
3-5 years of proven success in software sales, preferably within the financial services or credit union industry.
Ability to quickly learn and effectively demonstrate software solutions to potential clients.

title: Operations Manager
description:
Incorporating our company values: Accountability, Continuous Improvement, Customer Focus, Integrity, and Quality, this position will oversee the day-to-day activities of manufacturing, ensuring that production is managed and performing efficiently and effectively while promoting customer satisfaction that positively impacts the financial performance of Reese Pharmaceutical. The Operations Manager is a key contributor to the development of the company’s strategy and goals and is a member of the management team.  ResponsibilitiesAdds value as a key member of management; understands the business, financials, industry, customers, and strategy. Maintains adequate staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, developing, and performance management of production department, warehouse, and shipping employees. Supervises employees; provides direction, coaches, trains, and develops; and manages performance to company goals and expectations. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business procedures. Implements policies and procedures that will improve day-to-day operations. Ensures work environments are adequate and safe. Plans, directs, controls, implements, evaluates, monitors, and forecasts budgets to achieve financial objectives. In conjunction with VP of Finance and President. Develops and coordinates with VP of Finance and President on manufacturing capital plan. Direct efforts to ensure facility and equipment are adequately designed, built, and maintained. Initiate and coordinate major projects, including purchasing of new equipment, plant layout and other continuous improvement objectives. Ensures all product ships on time and is within quality standards. Promotes and monitors quality assurance and regulatory compliance initiatives; ensures appropriate internal controls are implemented and operated, as designed. Assists with the development of new products by assessing customers' needs, business trends, and through analysis of competitors' products. Projects a positive image of the organization to employees, customers, industry, and community. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by participating in continuing education efforts (i.e., workshops, college level classes, seminars, professional organizations, etc.).Creates and revises systems and procedures by analyzing operations practices, record-keeping systems, forms of control, and personnel requirements. Performs other related duties as assigned. 
Education/Experience: Bachelor's degree is required; degree in Business Management or a related field is preferred. Diversified background with at least 5 years of related experience; 3 or more years of management/supervisory experience. 
Qualifications/Other Requirements: Lean manufacturing certification preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal relationship skills. Superior managerial and diplomacy skills. Experience with regulatory authorities, including inspection preparation, execution, and response. Extremely proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.

title: Manufacturing Accountant
description:

title: Technical Sales Account Manager [Michigan]
description:
WHO ARE WE?AMPHENOL ADVANCED SENSORSAmphenol Advanced Sensors, with its portfolio of industry-leading brands—Thermometrics, NovaSensor, Telaire, Protimeter, and Kaye—is an industry-leading designer and manufacturer of sensors for transportation, industrial, and medical applications. Amphenol Advanced Sensors is a subsidiary of the Amphenol Corporation, a member of the Fortune 500 (NYSE:APH). Established in 1932, Amphenol has pioneered innovation in electronics for nearly a century. Amphenol is the central hub of cutting-edge electronic solutions across virtually every end market, including Automotive, Broadband Communications, Commercial Aerospace, Industrial, Information Technology and Data Communications, Defense, Mobile Devices, and Mobile Networks. 
Our unique, decentralized organizational structure fosters entrepreneurial leadership and drives excellent performance. We manage locally, enabling us to move at the speed of a small business, with the financial stability and global resources of an industry-leading, international company. ABOUT THE ROLEThe ideal candidate enthusiastically collaborates with customers to bring world-class sensing solutions to fit their needs. They should be a self-motivated experienced individual with exceptional selling skills and the ability to generate new customers that align with the company's strategic outlook. The ideal candidate should be able to effectively contribute to the company's overall financial targets related to sales, orders, and price.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSHunter function responsible to develop new products and grow sales for assigned productsDrive profitable sales growth with strategic accounts and building deep/sustaining relationships with clear roadmaps for growthDevelop/build new customer pipeline to secure long-term growth and meet business objectivesMaintain accurate sales/orders forecastsIdentify market trends and future/current customer needsReview/evaluate market conditions and customer demandsStay abreast of competitive situations and potential threatsIdentify/develop sales channelsCoordinate with regional teams to best serve global key accountsCustomers may include industrial, medical, transportation and/or consumer segmentsDomestic Travel - up to 60%
QUALIFICATIONS 4 Year Degree in a Technical discipline or Business DegreeProven sales success in relevant product marketing, engineering or OEM.Strong diplomacy and an analytical aptitudeMust have strong negotiation skills and high energy
Successful Amphenolians are Agile. Disciplined. Focused. Visionary. Driven. Ethical. Entrepreneurial. Collaborative.
WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?PEOPLE – We have the best people, over 1,700 of them across the globe who collaborate to bring our customers world class sensing solutions! Our culture is friendly, collaborative, and focused on serving our customers. We offer competitive benefits, retirement savings, generous paid time off, and more!INNOVATION – We are passionate about designing and building sensors! We believe that innovation comes from applying deep expertise to new problems. Most of our products are custom, and our customers rely on us to deliver value in our solutions. Across our organization, we encourage trying new things, making informed bets, and taking personal ownership to see changes through.EXCELLENCE – Not every manufacturer can lay claim to industry-leading performance. Our products offer the best value to our customers. We seek excellence in our performance, continuously improve, and deliver outstanding results. We make it happen!SUSTAINABILITY - We are committed to sustainability, and it is the core of our business. Our products are enabling revolutions in eMobility, energy efficient buildings, smart agriculture, and more. We match this commitment to sustainability in our purpose with sustainability within our own operations, prioritizing investments in our people, our environment, and the communities in which we work. 
Amphenol Advanced Sensors is committed to diversity in the workplace, and as such, we offer employment opportunities for all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetics or any other basis protected by applicable state and federal laws or Executive Orders. description:

title: VP, Private Equity Portfolio Performance Analytics
description:

Work with Engineering Manager to integrate requirements into training plansMeet with customers, OEMs and RSI team members onsite and remotely as required to perform job duties effectivelyAttain and retain certifications as requiredOther duties as assigned
Requirements
5+ years of equivalent network technology experienceCisco CCNP Security or CCIE Security, Palo Alto Networks PCNSE, or demonstrable experience level requiredHands on experience deploying and designing complex network security solutionsHands on experience with PAN firewalls requiredUnderstanding of security framworks and compliance requirements for regulated industries requiredHands on experience with Cisco Firepower firwalls preferredPalo Alto Networks PCNSE highly preferredHands on experience with Palo Alto Networks Prisma, Panorama, and PAN SDWAN solutions preferredStrong design and troubleshooting skills for firewalls requiredHands on experience with Fortinet firewalls or Fortinet NSE certification preferredExperience with network segementaiton and datacenter security best practicesExperience with design and deployment of Cisco ISE or Aruba Clearpass highly preferredPervious experience as a consultant desiredDeep understaning and experience with advanced routing and switching protocolsStrong interpersonal, written and oral communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsHighly self-motivated, directed and organized with attention to detail and accuracyAbility to effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced scenarioStrong customer service orientationExperience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environmentProficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word)Experience in CRM databasesCandidate must have a valid Driver’s license

Annual Pay DOE
RSI offers competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package that includes group medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance/LTD, and PTO (Paid Time Off) for vacation, sick and personal leave needs.

title: Field Technician
description:
Climate change is here! Take an active part in keeping our buildings safe and healthy for the future. Engineering consulting firm is offering a new unique opportunity to the successful Weatherproofing Inspector candidate who desires to build a career in the exciting field of Weatherproofing Science. Learn first hand from experts with many years of practical weatherproofing experience and knowledge while being part of a small business with a big 126-year history. Assist in conducting tests on large-scale construction, historic buildings, and pre- and post-construction projects including some of the most iconic buildings in New England.
Position Duties:Weatherproofing Inspector helps perform and learns specialized building enclosure services: weatherproofing tests and inspection services, along with forensic services, window, curtain wall, storefront, and door testing, FM Global wind uplift test, smoke test, and electronic leak detection tests. Is responsible for interpreting and recording findings, processing reports, and interfacing with clients. Performs other duties as assigned by the Director of Building Enclosure Services, such as daily reports, calibrating and maintaining equipment, bringing the company van to job sites, and assisting in the Construction Materials Testing Lab, if needed.
Requirements:· Engineering degree, preferably Civil Engineering· Preferred minimum of 3 years of experience in construction engineering, building inspection services, or building enclosure services· Ability to compose professional reports on a timely basis with accuracy and attention to detail· Willingness to learn and share knowledge· Excellent verbal and written communication skills, along with problem-solving, organizational, and time management skills in the field and office· Clean record from pre-employment background check (CORI)· Reliable vehicle, valid Driver’s License , and clean driving record· Physical abilities necessary: Ability to sit, stand, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls, reach with hands and arms, talk, and hear. Occasionally required to walk, sit, climb or balance, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Ability to lift up to 125 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. While in the field, may be required to walk in rugged conditions, work in adverse weather conditions, stand up to eight hours or more at a time, and work from heights (ex., from staging, ladders, boom-lift, scaffolding, or on roofs of high buildings). · Willingness to comply with safety procedures in the office and on job sites. Must wear attire appropriate with performing assigned duties safely. ANSI-approved footwear necessary. A hard hat, safety vest, and safety glasses are provided. · Must be legally authorized to work long-term in the US· OSHA-10 certification· Computer proficiency (MS Office and AutoCAD)This is a full-time entry-level position.
Compensation commensurate with education and experience.
BenefitsAvailable Benefits: Short Term Disability insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Health insurance (50% single plan company contribution), Vacation, 401(K), etc.

Job SummaryThis position may be eligible for remote work for candidates with prior research administration experience.
The University of Kentucky is excited to announce a new position in the Collaborative Grant Services (CGS) office/unit of the Vice President of Research.
This position is the result of a nearly year-long initiative to enhance administrative support for sponsored research at the University by providing high-quality, customer-service focused, and compliant research administration support to a large and varied group of investigators – faculty, staff, and students who are involved in innovative research across numerous disciplines, creating, discovering, and exploring the most complex problems facing Kentucky, our nation and the world.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, support of sponsored project proposal development including budget preparation, facilitation of internal approvals for proposal submissions, and contributing regular support through entry and analysis of data within various sponsor and university proposal-related systems. Additional responsibilities will be remaining current and knowledgeable on sponsored project policy and related university rules and regulations. The Pre-Award Grant Specialist Associate will also be responsible for providing exceptional customer service through timely response and follow-up related to these duties. All responsibilities will be completed with an advanced level of understanding for all grant pre-award processes.
The Collaborative Grant Services (CGS) department has been created in response to Project GATeWAY (Grants Administration Transformation as the WAY forward). Over the last decade, UK has nearly doubled its total awards for sponsored research, and in the past 5 years, sponsored research has grown more than 40%. Project GATeWAY serves as the leap forward into the future of grants administration at UK. More information can be found at: https://www.research.uky.edu/resources/project-gateway

Required Education / ExperienceTo qualify for these positions, the required education / experience is … Master’s degree and four (4) year of experience OR equivalent (below)
High School diploma or GED and ten (10) years of experienceAssociate’s degree and eight (8) years of experienceBachelor’s degree and six (6) years of experienceDoctorate degree and one (1) year of experience
Related experience includes: Grant proposal, Grant management, Grant administration, Finance, Accounting, Budgeting, Program coordination, and/or Administrative/Administration The University of Kentucky uses equivalencies in determining if a potential applicant meets the minimum education and experience. Related experience can be substituted for education. Click here for more information about equivalencies: http://www.uky.edu/hr/employment/working-uk/equivalencies
Required License/Registration/CertificationNone
Preferred Education / ExperienceMaster’s degree or equivalent plus four years related experience. Working knowledge of federal grant and academic institution sponsored research regulations. Certified Research Administrator (CRA) preferred.

University Community of InclusionThe University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance.
